conductingBody: National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) on behalf of Pharmacy Council of India (PCI)
eligibility: Bachelorâ€™s degree in Pharmacy (4 years after 10+2, including lateral entry candidates). Final year students of B.Pharm are also eligible. B.Tech (Pharmaceutical and Fine Chemical Technology) or equivalent is NOT eligible.
negativeMarking: Yes (-1 for each incorrect answer, +4 for each correct answer)

faqs.question: What is the marking scheme for GPAT?
faqs.answer: Each correct answer is awarded 4 marks. For every incorrect answer, 1 mark is deducted. No marks are deducted for unattempted questions.
